item.title: Steve part 8
item.description: The Resurrection of Steve Steve has been collecting dust for some time in my workshop. Over the last year I have replaced the TinyBX controller with an esp32 and replaced the level converter with a simpler stable level converter. I have been spending some of my shed time fixing TODO and making sure that there is progression across all systems. I managed to finally get feature parity on the rust firmware last night (20221218) and impressed the kids by driving it around with the web interface on my mobile phone.

item.title: Getting gateware going
item.description: Finally managed to get TX working on the gateware uart, RX is next. Having a UART means that it can talk to the outside world.

item.title: Steve part 5
item.description:
mmmm BRAINS

Now that I have the TinyBX mounted and connected the time has come to get some gateware going. After some research I settled on nMigen. It is constant development and m-labs is working hard to get it running. There is a repository of my code as I develop it.

item.title: Steve part 4
item.description: STEVE’s new look orginal image A 3.3V supply has been added to drive the TinyFPGA-BX and other 3.3V devices. Once the power supply was tuned (tiny multiturn pot) some nail polish was painted on the screw so it does not move. The 10V rail (8 AA , NiMH) has been covered with Kapton tape to avoid accidental shorts. There is also a 5<->3.3V signal converter, so there are 8 lines that can be broken out to the other side of STEVE.
